results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Teachers and School Employees;Robb Elementary School (Uvalde, Tex);Uvalde (Tex)
results.title: The husband of a teacher killed in the massacre has died of a heart attack.
results.abstract: The couple had been married for 24 years and had four children, with the oldest 23 and the others teenagers.

media.caption: Joe Garcia and his wife, Irma Garcia. Mr. Garcia died of a heart attack two days after his wife was killed in the shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde.

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Robb Elementary School (Uvalde, Tex);Uvalde (Tex);Texas
results.title: Students in the room with the gunman called 911 many times.
results.abstract: Students who were in the classroom with the gunman called 911 several times, including a lengthy call during which some shooting and other sounds of the attack could be heard, according to Steven McCraw, director of the Texas Department of Public Safety.

results.title: Ray Liotta, of ‘Goodfellas’ and ‘Field of Dreams,’ Dies at 67
results.abstract: He was known for his intensity, especially in crime dramas, but he was also adept at comedy. “You want to do as many different genres as you can,” he once said.

media.caption: Ray Liotta in the 2005 film "Revolver," directed by Guy Ritchie.

results.adx_keywords: Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Elections, Governors;Politics and Government;United States Politics and Government;Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;Frauds and Swindling;Craig, James;Johnson, Perry (1948- );Whitmer, Gretchen;Benson, Jocelyn;Republican Party;Michigan
results.title: Five G.O.P. candidates for Michigan governor are ruled ineligible over forged petition signatures.
results.abstract: James Craig and Perry Johnson, two of the party’s top contenders, were denied spots on the ballot by a state canvassing board. The party-line decision is expected to draw lawsuits.

media.caption: James Craig, a former Detroit police chief and Republican candidate for governor of Michigan.

results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Adam Bednar
results.title: The Johnny Depp vs. Amber Heard Libel Case Is in the Jury’s Hands
results.abstract: After closing arguments, the judge asked a jury in Virginia to decide a defamation trial that focused as much on domestic abuse as damaged reputations.

media.caption: Johnny Depp listened to closing arguments as the libel case with his ex-wife, Amber Heard, entered its final phase.
media.copyright: Pool Photo via Steve Helber/Agence France-Presse -- Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);James, Letitia;Trump, Donald J;New York State
results.byline: By Ben Protess, William K. Rashbaum and Jonah E. Bromwich
results.title: Trump’s Federal Suit Against New York A.G. Is Dismissed
results.abstract: Mr. Trump had argued that an inquiry by the attorney general, Letitia James, violated his constitutional rights. It was his second legal loss in two days.

media.caption: The ruling clears the way for Letitia James, the New York attorney general, to complete her civil investigation into Donald J. Trump in the coming weeks or months.
media.copyright: Veasey Conway for The New York Times

results.title: TikTok’s Amber Heard Hate Machine
results.abstract: Television turned the celebrity trial into a 24-hour tabloid spectacle. Social media made it into a sport.

media.caption: On social media, the visages of Johnny Depp and Amber Heard have been frozen into masks of comedy and tragedy — he is perpetually smirking, she is permanently aggrieved.

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Jews and Judaism;Holocaust and the Nazi Era;Archives and Records;Kertzer, David I;Pius XII;Francis;Roman Catholic Church;Italy;Vatican City
results.title: Deep in Vatican Archives, Scholar Discovers ‘Flabbergasting’ Secrets
results.abstract: David Kertzer has spent decades excavating the Vatican’s hidden history, with his work winning a Pulitzer and capturing Hollywood’s attention. A new book examines Pope Pius XII’s role in the Holocaust.

media.caption: David Kertzer at the library of the American Academy in Rome, after a day of scholarly investigations inside the Vatican’s archives.
media.copyright: Massimo Berruti for The New York Times

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: A Face Search Engine Anyone Can Use Is Alarmingly Accurate
results.abstract: PimEyes is a paid service that finds photos of a person from across the internet, including some the person may not want exposed. “We’re just a tool provider,” its owner said.

media.caption: The original photo used to do an image search on PimEyes, left, and just a few of its results for the author, Kashmir Hill.

results.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff, Frances Robles, J. David Goodman and Serge F. Kovaleski
results.title: Police Response to Uvalde Shooting Infuriated Parents Clinging to Hope
results.abstract: Law enforcement killed the gunman more than an hour after the first officers arrived at an elementary school in Texas. Nineteen students and two teachers died in the attack.

media.caption: Alexandria Rubio’s family members at a makeshift memorial in the center of Uvalde.
media.copyright: Meridith Kohut for The New York Times

results.title: Cockroach Reproduction Has Taken a Strange Turn
results.abstract: In response to pesticides, many cockroach females have lost their taste for sweet stuff, which changes how they make the next generation of insects.

media.caption: A male cockroach, right, attracting a female cockroach with a fat-and-sugar mix extruded from the tergal gland. Some female cockroaches are becoming immune to this practice.

results.title: Documents Shed Light on Secret U.S. Plans for Apocalyptic Scenarios
results.abstract: Dating back to 1950s preparations for nuclear war and revised after the Sept. 11 attacks, the presidential directives are not shown to Congress.
org_facet: Bush, George W, Presidential Library and Museum

media.caption: The executive branch has drafted dozens of classified directives that presidents can issue swiftly in a catastrophe.

results.title: Three headliners pulled out of this week’s N.R.A. convention, citing Uvalde.
results.abstract: Don McLean and Larry Gatlin withdrew out of respect to the victims, as teachers’ unions joined protests for gun control planned in Houston.

media.caption: Singer Don McLean performing at The Canyon Club in Agoura Hills, Calif., in 2017.

results.title: Five Killed as House Explodes in Pennsylvania
results.abstract: Two others were hospitalized in Pottstown on Friday, officials said. The cause of the explosion was not immediately known.

media.caption: The scene of an explosion in Pottstown, Pa., on Thursday. Officials reported that five people were killed.
